commitResults.messageTitle: - Edited .gitignore to exclude Java .class files - Implemented Duke Level-1
- Implemented Level-2: Add, List
- Implemented Level-3: Mark as Done - Added Task Class - Added new checks for mark and unmark ISSUES: - Many invalid inputs can cause a crash

Implemented Level-4. ToDos, Events, Deadlines - Added new classes Todo, Events and Deadlines - Moved input processing to separate method - Added separate method for generating list - Moved some text as static variables - Task has more methods
Added A-TextUiTesting
Level-5: Handle Errors - Reorganized code into packages - Created custom exceptions - Edited runtest.bat to pause - Added new method to check for invalid number inputs
Level 6. Delete - Fixed a bug where if no index is entered, program will crash - Added delete method and generate message for delete
commitResults.messageBody:
Todo:
- Haven't written test case for delete and error checking

commitResults.messageTitle: Added Enum - Added InputEnum but not used yet
Move and reorganize code into packages
Add functionality to save tasklist to a file Tasklist is not persistent and is cleared everytime the program closes.
commitResults.messageBody:
With this new change, the tasklist will now be saved and the list will persist through multiple runs

Reads from the file on launch and saves for every change to the tasklist

Changes:
- Add new functions and constructors for Tasks to support adding existing tasks from file
- New saving and reading functionality (tasklist now saves)
- New FileHandler class which deals with reading and writing the tasklist file
- Add changes to runtest.bat to include testing for the tasklist file
- Add task.txt to .gitignore

commitResults.messageTitle: Replace string representation of date with proper date object Date was represented by string.
commitResults.messageBody:
With this new change, a date object will be used to store the date instead.

Changes:
- Add new abstract TaskWithDate object to further OOP
- Add new getDate method for Tasks with Dates

commitResults.messageTitle: Clean up merge with Level 7 and Level 8 There were some code issues between both commits
Implemented TextUi class The main Duke class used to handle all the input and output
commitResults.messageBody:
New class has been made to abstract the UI functions from the main class

Changes:
- Created new classes for Parser, TaskList, TextUi
- Changed FileHandler to Storage (name)

commitResults.messageTitle: Restructure entire program to make it more OOP Main class Duke used to handle all the main logic. Now it's split to its individual categories.
commitResults.messageBody:
This makes expansion for each element harder in the future

To make the code more OOP, each function has it's own class and tree structure. UI, Storage, Parser, TaskList,

Changes:
- Coded Parser
- Added TextUi class which handles all input and output
- TaskList abstraction added
- Command package added. Each command has it's own class
- Removed unnecessary InputEnum.java

To Do:
- Add more functionality to CommandResult and get rid of getTaskList function from TaskList (encapsulation issues)

Duke could not search for tasks

Now Duke can use a key word to search for tasks with that keyword

- Added search functionality
- Updated test case to test for search

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix some checkstyle issues
commitResults.messageBody: Add CommandTest class as well (not implemented yet)

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix some JavaDocs formatting issues
Fix more JavaDocs stuff
Fix some issues with build.gradle
Add assertions in various points of the code
commitResults.messageBody:
There are several methods with calculations of an index of an array. There are also cases where a method is assumed to mark an task as done or undone. These calculations and methods are assumed to work correctly.

Using assertions in these methods ensure that these calculations of indexes are within range and that tasks are marked correctly as well.

Assertions are used after the calculations or method call.

build.gradle updated to enable Assertions in testing and running

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor code from Parser.java
commitResults.messageBody:
The parseCommand method is considered a long method with very hard to follow logic.

Splitting the method to smaller methods would improve code quality.

By changing the if-else statement to a switch-case and moving most of the logic to other smaller methods, code quality of parseCommand would improve. parseCommand would also have the same level of abstraction.

Also clean up some code where there are unnecessary else statements and merged some try-catch blocks as well.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor code from Storage.java
commitResults.messageBody:
Multiple methods were long and convoluted.

Splitting the method to smaller methods would improve code quality.

By changing the if-else statement to a switch-case and moving most of the logic to other smaller methods, code quality would improve.

Also created a ImportTaskParameters class to store parameter details for an imported task.
Also fixed an issue where the task list wasn't saving in GUI mode.
Also fixed an FXML error

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Postpone feature
commitResults.messageBody:
In previous versions, editing the dates for Event and Postpone tasks is not possible. The only way to do it is by deleting the task and adding it back with the correct date.

With this new version, the "postpone" keyword can be used to edit the date for those types of tasks. The command syntax is "postpone TASKNO DATE"
